intro: Diplotaxis virgata var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features alternate, linear to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by spherical, hairy seed heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
